The bicameral federal legislature of Nepal consists of the National Assembly as the upper house and the House of Representatives as the lower house. The National Assembly is composed of members elected by an electoral college, members nominated by the President, and members elected through a single transferable vote system. The House of Representatives is elected through a mixed electoral system, including first-past-the-post and proportional representation.

The Federal Parliament of Nepal, comprising the National Assembly and the House of Representatives, is responsible for enacting laws, overseeing the government, and representing the people. It plays a crucial role in the governance and legislative processes of Nepal.

Answer:
The parliament of Nepal is called the "Federal Parliament of Nepal" or "संघीय संसद नेपाल". It is a bicameral legislature consisting of the National Assembly and the House of Representatives.
